title: Strengthening Medicaid and the Affordable Care Act

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to strengthen and protect Medicaid and the Affordable Care Act (ACA), including reviewing and reversing policies that reduce healthcare coverage or make it harder to access. It also calls for a special enrollment period during the COVID-19 pandemic to help uninsured Americans gain health insurance.
potential_concerns: The review and reversal of prior policies may encounter legal and administrative delays, slowing implementation.
Expanding enrollment options could strain healthcare marketplaces and providers without additional resources.
Some stakeholders may oppose revoking previous executive orders, leading to political and legal challenges.
Efforts to expand coverage may increase federal spending, raising budgetary concerns.
Ensuring equitable access for marginalized communities requires effective outreach, which may be difficult during the ongoing pandemic.
